intro: Unonopsis guaraya, commonly known as the Guayara tree, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a large evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, dark bark and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory properties. The tree plays an important ecological role in providing habitat and food for various rainforest species.
